# The open source background jobs platform
Write workflows in normal async code and we’ll handle the rest, from queues to elastic scaling. No timeouts, retries, observability, and zero infrastructure to manage.
[Get started now](https://trigger.dev/<https:/cloud.trigger.dev>)
![Trigger.dev dashboard](https://trigger.dev/images/hero-image-dashboard.png)
AI tasks
Video processing
Cron
Waits
Workflows
AI Agent
Concurrency
Retries
PDF to images
Semantic search
Email campaign
```

// Generate an image using OpenAI Dall-E 3
exportconst generateContent =task({
 id:"generate-content",
 retry:{
  maxAttempts:3,
},
run:async({ theme, description }: Payload)=>{
const textResult =await openai.chat.completions.create({
   model:"gpt-4o",
   messages:generateTextPrompt(theme, description),
});
if(!textResult.choices[0]){
thrownewError("No content, retrying…");
}
const imageResult =await openai.images.generate({
   model:"dall-e-3",
   prompt:generateImagePrompt(theme, description),
});
if(!imageResult.data[0]){
thrownewError("No image, retrying…");
}
return{
   text: textResult.choices[0],
   image: imageResult.data[0].url,
};
},
});

```

Reliably call AI APIs with no timeouts, automatic retrying, and tracing. Use existing Node.js SDKs and code from your repo.
[Learn more about AI tasks](https://trigger.dev/<https:/trigger.dev/docs/guides/ai-agents/overview>)

## Deploy and scale to any size
### No timeouts
Write simple, reliable code and never hit a timeout.
### Pay for what you use
Only pay when your code is actually executing.
### No servers to manage
We deploy your tasks and handle scaling for you.
## Find and fix bugs fast
### Alerts for errors
Get notified via email, Slack or webhooks when your tasks or deployments fail.
![hero](https://trigger.dev/patterns/alerts-bg.png)
### Advanced filtering
Find runs fast using advanced filtering options, then apply bulk actions to multiple tasks at once.
![hero](https://trigger.dev/patterns/alerts-bg.png)
### Versioning
Each deploy is an atomic version ensuring started tasks are not affected by code changes.
![hero](https://trigger.dev/patterns/alerts-bg.png)

## Reliable by default
[Docs](https://trigger.dev/<https:/trigger.dev/docs/v3/errors-retrying>)
#### Task retrying
Configure automatic retrying for tasks.
#### handleError()
Conditional retrying based on the error and run.
#### retry.onThrow()
Fine-grained retrying inside tasks.
#### retry.fetch()
Automatically retry requests based on the response.
#### trigger.config
Configure default retrying in your config file.
```

import{ task }from"@trigger.dev/sdk/v3";
exportconst simpleTask =task({
 id:"simple-task",
 retry:{
  maxAttempts:3,
  minTimeoutInMs:1000,
  maxTimeoutInMs:5000,
  factor:2,
  randomize:true,
},
run:async(payload,{ ctx })=>{
  logger.log(`Attempt ${ctx.attempt.number}`);
try{
thrownewError("This is an error.");
}catch(error){
// The error was caught, so no retry
}
thrownewError("This will cause a retry.");
},
});

```

// Generate an image using OpenAI Dall-E 3
exportconst generateContent =task({
 id:"generate-content",
 retry:{
  maxAttempts:3,
},
run:async({ theme, description }: Payload)=>{
const textResult =await openai.chat.completions.create({
   model:"gpt-4o",
   messages:generateTextPrompt(theme, description),
});
if(!textResult.choices[0]){
thrownewError("No content, retrying…");
}
const imageResult =await openai.images.generate({
   model:"dall-e-3",
   prompt:generateImagePrompt(theme, description),
});
if(!imageResult.data[0]){
thrownewError("No image, retrying…");
}
return{
   text: textResult.choices[0],
   image: imageResult.data[0].url,
};
},
});

## Reliable by default
Docs⟨55⟩
#### Task retrying
Configure automatic retrying for tasks.
#### handleError()
Conditional retrying based on the error and run.
#### retry.onThrow()
Fine-grained retrying inside tasks.
#### retry.fetch()
Automatically retry requests based on the response.
#### trigger.config
Configure default retrying in your config file.
```

import{ task }from"@trigger.dev/sdk/v3";
exportconst simpleTask =task({
 id:"simple-task",
 retry:{
  maxAttempts:3,
  minTimeoutInMs:1000,
  maxTimeoutInMs:5000,
  factor:2,
  randomize:true,
},
run:async(payload,{ ctx })=>{
  logger.log(`Attempt ${ctx.attempt.number}`);
try{
thrownewError("This is an error.");
}catch(error){
// The error was caught, so no retry
}
thrownewError("This will cause a retry.");
},
});

```

**Trigger.dev: Revolutionizing Background Jobs for Developers**

Founded in 2022 and part of Y Combinator's Batch W23, Trigger.dev is on a mission to simplify background job management by offering an open-source platform with no timeouts. It allows developers to write durable background jobs directly in their codebase, ensuring reliability and flexibility.

### What’s the Big Idea?

Initially kickstarted from the success of creating JSON Hero—a popular open-source JSON viewer used by over 35,000 developers—Trigger.dev builds on that momentum. The founders, Eric and Matt, come from rich backgrounds in tech; Eric was the CTO of Code School, while Matt created award-winning iPad apps. Their collective experience forms a solid foundation for Trigger.dev's ambitious goals.

### Why Trigger.dev Stands Out

1. **No Timeouts:** Developers can now write simple, reliable code that won’t run into latency issues.  
2. **Pay-for-What-You-Use Model:** Their pricing model only charges when tasks actively execute.
3. **No Server Management:** The platform takes on the complexities of scaling and infrastructure management, letting developers focus on building.

### Key Features

- **Realtimely Connect:** Seamless integration of frontend applications with task management.
- **Concurrency Control:** Fine-tune how many tasks run concurrently, optimizing performance.
- **Observability & Monitoring:** Real-time insights into task performance.
- **Durable Scheduling:** Set up cron jobs that won't time out.

With a lean team of five based in London, Trigger.dev marries innovative technology with user needs, and their open-source approach (Apache 2.0 licensed) greatly appeals to a developer-centric audience.

### Community and Adoption

Trigger.dev is seeing traction in the developer community, evidenced by over 10.3k stars on GitHub and a vibrant Discord chat group with 3.1k members. Developers from various companies attest to its transformative impact on their workflows. 

### Testimonials and Backing

Renowned entities like Supabase and Dropbox back Trigger.dev, validating its potential to redefine how background jobs are handled. Users describe it as a game-changer—if you previously needed a complex setup of AWS Lambda with restrictive timeout limits, Trigger.dev offers a much smoother ride.

### Conclusion

If you're developing applications that require robust backend job processing without the hassle of timeouts and server management, Trigger.dev is definitely worth exploring. Their streamlined documentation and quick start guides make it easy to dive in, ensuring you can get up and running in a matter of minutes.

**Ready to simplify your background job processes? Check out [Trigger.dev](https://trigger.dev) and start building today!**
